es.definition: Representar un comportamiento o situación a través de acciones en lugar de palabras; actuar de manera inapropiada o impulsiva.

pt.definition: Representar um comportamento ou situação por meio de ações em vez de palavras; agir de forma inadequada ou impulsiva.

type_word.name: Phrasal Verb
type_word.description: A verb combined with a preposition or an adverb (or both), where the combination creates a meaning different from the original verb, such as 'turn off' or 'run into'.

definition: To represent behavior or a situation through actions rather than words; to behave inappropriately or impulsively.
examples: Children often act out their feelings through play.
He tends to act out when he's feeling stressed.
The therapy encourages patients to act out their emotions in a safe environment.

es.definition: A pesar de que; sin embargo.

pt.definition: Apesar de que; no entanto.

type_word.name: Conjunction
type_word.description: Words that connect clauses, sentences, words, or phrases.

definition: In spite of the fact that; however.
examples: Although it was raining, they went for a walk.
He studied hard, although the exam was easy.
She loves chocolate, although she's trying to eat healthier.

es.definition: Se puede argumentar; posiblemente.

pt.definition: Pode-se argumentar; possivelmente.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: It can be argued; possibly.
examples: Arguably, this is the best pizza in town.
He is arguably the most talented musician of his generation.
The decision was arguably the most important of her career.

es.definition: Sin embargo; no obstante.

pt.definition: No entanto; ainda assim.

type_word.name: Conjunction
type_word.description: Words that connect clauses, sentences, words, or phrases.

definition: However; nonetheless.
examples: She was tired; nevertheless, she continued working.
It was a difficult journey; nevertheless, they enjoyed it.
He had little experience; nevertheless, he was confident in his abilities.

es.definition: El punto medio del invierno; la mitad del período invernal.

pt.definition: O ponto médio do inverno; metade do período de inverno.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The middle point of winter; the halfway point of the winter season.
examples: In midwinter, the days are shortest and the nights are longest.
Midwinter festivities celebrate the turning point toward longer days.
The animals prepare for hibernation during midwinter.

es.definition: En esencia; fundamentalmente.

pt.definition: Na essência; fundamentalmente.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: In essence; fundamentally.
examples: He is essentially a good person.
The plan is essentially the same as before.
Essentially, the problem boils down to a lack of communication.

es.definition: Necesario; fundamental; esencial.

pt.definition: Necessário; fundamental; essencial.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Necessary; fundamental; essential.
examples: Water is essential for life.
Good communication is essential in any relationship.
It's essential to have a plan before starting a project.

es.definition: Artículos o elementos necesarios o fundamentales.

pt.definition: Itens ou elementos necessários ou fundamentais.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Necessary or fundamental items or elements.
examples: The essentials for camping include a tent, sleeping bag, and food.
She packed the essentials for her trip.

es.definition: Se puede argumentar; posiblemente.

pt.definition: Pode-se argumentar; possivelmente.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: It can be argued; possibly.
examples: Arguably, this is the best pizza in town.
He is arguably the most talented musician of his generation.
The decision was arguably the most important of her career.

es.definition: Sujeto a debate o discusión; que puede ser cuestionado.

pt.definition: Sujeito a debate ou discussão; que pode ser questionado.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Subject to debate or discussion; capable of being questioned.
examples: The effectiveness of the new policy is arguable.
His argument was strong, but still arguable.
The decision is arguable from both sides.

es.definition: La forma posesiva de 'arguably'; perteneciente o relacionado a algo que se puede argumentar.

pt.definition: A forma possessiva de 'discutivelmente'; pertencente ou relacionado a algo que pode ser argumentado.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The possessive form of 'arguably'; pertaining to or related to something that can be argued.
examples: The arguably's impact on the debate was significant.
We analyzed the argument's strengths and weaknesses.

es.definition: Evidencia o demostración de la veracidad o autenticidad de algo; una versión impresa de un trabajo.

pt.definition: Evidência ou demonstração da veracidade ou autenticidade de algo; uma versão impressa de um trabalho.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Evidence or demonstration of the truth or authenticity of something; a printed version of a work.
examples: The proof of his innocence was presented in court.
She received a proof of her book before publication.

es.definition: Versiones impresas de un trabajo o documento para su revisión; evidencias o demostraciones de la verdad o autenticidad de algo.

pt.definition: Versões impressas de um trabalho ou documento para revisão; evidências ou demonstrações da verdade ou autenticidade de algo.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Printed versions of a work or document for review; evidence or demonstration of the truth or authenticity of something.
examples: The author received the proofs of her manuscript for final approval.
The proofs of his claims were presented to the committee.

es.definition: Tratado o preparado para resistir o proteger contra ciertas condiciones o eventos.

pt.definition: Tratado ou preparado para resistir ou proteger contra certas condições ou eventos.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Treated or prepared to resist or protect against certain conditions or events.
examples: The fabric of the jacket is proofed against water.
The document has been proofed to ensure accuracy.

es.definition: El proceso de tratar o preparar algo para resistir o proteger contra ciertas condiciones o eventos.

pt.definition: O processo de tratar ou preparar algo para resistir ou proteger contra certas condições ou eventos.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The process of treating or preparing something to resist or protect against certain conditions or events.
examples: The proofing of the building includes fire-resistant materials.
Proofing the dough is an important step in baking.

es.definition: Lo peor; la situación o condición más desfavorable.

pt.definition: O pior; a situação ou condição mais desfavorável.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: The worst; the most unfavorable situation or condition.
examples: This is the worst day of my life.
She faced the worst possible outcome.

es.definition: De inferior calidad o más desfavorable en comparación con otra cosa.

pt.definition: De qualidade inferior ou mais desfavorável em comparação com outra coisa.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: Of inferior quality or more unfavorable compared to another thing.
examples: Her health got worse after the surgery.
This movie is worse than the last one we watched.
He felt worse after eating the spoiled food.
The weather is worse today than yesterday.
Her performance this year was worse than last year.
The traffic gets worse during rush hour.

es.definition: De manera incorrecta o inadecuada.

pt.definition: De maneira incorreta ou inadequada.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: In a wrong or inadequate manner.
examples: He performed badly on the test.
The team played badly in the final game.
She was badly injured in the accident.
The project was badly managed.
The machine is working badly and needs repair.
His comments were received badly by the audience.

es.definition: De la más baja calidad o el más desfavorable de todos.

pt.definition: De mais baixa qualidade ou o mais desfavorável de todos.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Of the lowest quality or the most unfavorable of all.
examples: That was the worsest mistake he ever made.
Of all her performances, this was the worsest.
He considered it the worsest day of his life.
Among the options, this one is the worsest.
This is the worsest weather we've had all year.
In her opinion, it was the worsest book she ever read.

es.definition: Ser supremo adorado en diversas religiones, creador y gobernador del universo.

pt.definition: Ser supremo adorado em várias religiões, criador e governante do universo.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

type_word.name: Proper Noun
type_word.description: Specific names of people, places, organizations, etc., that are capitalized.

definition: Supreme being worshiped in various religions, creator and ruler of the universe.
examples: Many cultures have different beliefs about God.
She prayed to God for guidance.
The concept of God varies across religions.
In monotheistic religions, God is believed to be the only deity.
The study of God is known as theology.
People often turn to God in times of distress.

es.definition: Seres supremos adorados en diversas religiones, considerados creadores o gobernadores del universo.

pt.definition: Seres supremos adorados em várias religiões, considerados criadores ou governantes do universo.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

type_word.name: Proper Noun
type_word.description: Specific names of people, places, organizations, etc., that are capitalized.

definition: Supreme beings worshiped in various religions, considered creators or rulers of the universe.
examples: Ancient Greeks believed in many gods.
Temples were built to honor the gods.
Myths often describe the powers of gods.
In polytheistic religions, gods have specific roles.
Offerings were made to appease the gods.
The gods of ancient Egypt are well-documented.

es.definition: Perteneciente o relacionado con un dios o dioses; sagrado.

pt.definition: Pertencente ou relacionado a um deus ou deuses; sagrado.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Belonging to or related to a god or gods; sacred.
examples: He was known for his godly wisdom.
The priest led a godly life.
She had a godly reverence for nature.
Their godly virtues were admired by many.
He sought to achieve a godly character.
The temple was a place of godly worship.

es.definition: Que tiene cualidades o aspectos semejantes a los de un dios.

pt.definition: Que possui qualidades ou aspectos semelhantes aos de um deus.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Having qualities or aspects similar to those of a god.
examples: The hero had godlike powers in the story.
She admired his godlike patience.
His knowledge seemed almost godlike.
They attributed godlike abilities to the leader.
The artist's skill was considered godlike.
In the myth, he was granted godlike strength.

es.definition: Cubierto densamente de hojas o follaje, típicamente refiriéndose a árboles o arbustos.

pt.definition: Coberto densamente de folhas ou folhagem, tipicamente referindo-se a árvores ou arbustos.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Densely covered with leaves or foliage, typically referring to trees or bushes.
examples: The garden was full of bushy plants.
He had a bushy beard.
The bushy tail of the squirrel was noticeable.
They trimmed the bushy hedges around the house.
The cat had a bushy coat of fur.

es.definition: Que tiene más hojas, ramas o follaje; más denso o tupido.

pt.definition: Que tem mais folhas, ramos ou folhagem; mais denso ou espesso.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Having more leaves, branches, or foliage; denser or thicker.
examples: The gardener trimmed the bushier parts of the hedge.
He noticed that the plants were becoming bushier as spring progressed.
Bushier eyebrows can give a more youthful appearance.
The forest was dense with bushier undergrowth.
Bushier beards have become a fashion trend.

es.definition: La forma superlativa de frondoso, indicando la máxima densidad o espesor de hojas, ramas o follaje.

pt.definition: A forma superlativa de frondoso, indicando a máxima densidade ou espessura de folhas, ramos ou folhagem.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Superlative form of bushy, indicating the greatest density or thickness of leaves, branches, or foliage.
examples: The bushiest trees in the garden provided the most shade.
His beard was the bushiest in the family.
The bushiest part of the forest was almost impenetrable.
She won the contest for the bushiest eyebrows.
The bushiest shrubs needed the most trimming.

es.definition: La estación más fría del año, caracterizada por días cortos y noches largas.

pt.definition: A estação mais fria do ano, caracterizada por dias curtos e noites longas.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The middle part of winter, often the coldest phase of the season.
examples: The city was covered in snow during midwinter.
Midwinter celebrations often involve lighting fires and candles.
Farmers prepare for planting after the midwinter thaw.
The midwinter solstice marks the shortest day of the year.
They planned a midwinter getaway to a warmer climate.

es.definition: Plural de invierno; múltiples períodos de la estación fría del año.

pt.definition: Plural de inverno; múltiplos períodos da estação fria do ano.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Plural of midwinter; multiple periods of the cold season of the year.
examples: She reminisced about the midwinters of her childhood.
The village has faced harsh midwinters for decades.
Midwinters in the north are known for their extreme cold.
The museum held an exhibit on historical midwinters.
Birds migrate south before the midwinters set in.

es.definition: Los límites o bordes de un país, estado, o área.

pt.definition: Os limites ou bordas de um país, estado ou área.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The boundaries or edges of a country, state, or area.
examples: The river forms the natural borders between the two countries.
They traveled across several state borders on their road trip.
Historical events have reshaped the borders of many nations.
Borders are often marked by fences or walls.
Cultural exchanges occur frequently in border towns.

es.definition: Relacionado con o situado en la frontera.

pt.definition: Relacionado a ou situado na fronteira.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Surrounded or flanked by borders; having a boundary.
examples: The park is bordered by two streets and a river.
The quilt was beautifully bordered with intricate designs.
The field bordered a dense forest.
Their property is bordered by tall hedges for privacy.
She wore a scarf bordered with lace.

es.definition: Estar en el proceso de crear o establecer una frontera.

pt.definition: Estar no processo de criar ou estabelecer uma fronteira.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: In the process of creating or establishing a border.
examples: The two countries were bordering on a territorial dispute.
The garden was bordering the backyard fence.
He was interested in the cultures bordering the Mediterranean Sea.
The town is bordering a national park.
They were bordering on a major decision for the company.

es.definition: La disposición de ser amigable, generoso y considerado; actitud positiva y cooperativa.

pt.definition: A disposição de ser amigável, generoso e considerado; atitude positiva e cooperativa.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The disposition to be friendly, generous, and considerate; positive and cooperative attitude.
examples: The charity event was held in the spirit of goodwill.
Goodwill between nations is essential for global peace.
She offered her help out of goodwill.
The company has built up considerable goodwill over the years.
Exchanging gifts is a sign of goodwill during the holidays.

es.definition: El acto de llevar algo o a alguien a un lugar y dejarlo allí.

pt.definition: O ato de levar algo ou alguém a um lugar e deixá-lo lá.

type_word.name: Phrasal Verb
type_word.description: A verb combined with a preposition or an adverb (or both), where the combination creates a meaning different from the original verb, such as 'turn off' or 'run into'.

definition: The act of taking something or someone to a place and leaving them there.
examples: He's dropping off the kids at school.
I'm dropping off your package at the post office.
She was dropping off donations at the charity shop.
We're dropping off supplies at the campsite.
They spent the morning dropping off flyers in the neighborhood.

es.definition: Haber llevado y dejado algo o a alguien en un lugar.

pt.definition: Ter levado e deixado algo ou alguém em um lugar.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: To have taken and left something or someone at a place.
examples: He had already dropped off the mail.
She had dropped off her friend at the airport.
The package was dropped off this morning.
I had dropped off the car at the mechanic's.
They had dropped off the kids at their grandparents' house.

es.definition: Llevar algo o a alguien a un lugar y dejarlo allí.

pt.definition: Levar algo ou alguém a um lugar e deixá-lo lá.

type_word.name: Phrasal Verb
type_word.description: A verb combined with a preposition or an adverb (or both), where the combination creates a meaning different from the original verb, such as 'turn off' or 'run into'.

definition: To take something or someone to a place and leave them there.
examples: Can you drop off the books at the library?
We need to drop off the car at the garage.
She will drop off the kids at school in the morning.
Please drop off the dry cleaning on your way to work.
He's going to drop off some supplies at the event.

es.definition: Hablar o escribir de manera desordenada o sin rumbo fijo.

pt.definition: Falar ou escrever de maneira desorganizada ou sem direção fixa.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Talking or writing in a disorganized or aimless way.
examples: His speech was rambling and hard to follow.
She had a tendency to start rambling when nervous.
The rambling nature of the book made it a difficult read.
They enjoyed their rambling conversation.
The path was perfect for a leisurely rambling walk.

es.definition: Plural de divagación; múltiples instancias de hablar o escribir de manera desordenada.

pt.definition: Plural de divagação; múltiplas instâncias de falar ou escrever de maneira desorganizada.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Plural of ramble; multiple instances of talking or writing in a disorganized way.
examples: His lectures were full of interesting rambles.
The book contains many rambles through various topics.
They went on long rambles in the countryside.
Her diary was a collection of personal rambles.
The rambles of his mind were hard to follow.

es.definition: Haber hablado o escrito de manera desordenada o sin rumbo.

pt.definition: Ter falado ou escrito de maneira desorganizada ou sem rumo.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: To have talked or written in a disorganized or aimless way.
examples: She rambled on about her vacation.
During the meeting, he rambled about unrelated topics.
The author rambled through various subjects.
He rambled for hours without reaching a conclusion.
The letter rambled, making it difficult to understand.

es.definition: Actuar con urgencia o rapidez; moverse o hacer algo rápidamente.

pt.definition: Agir com urgência ou rapidez; mover-se ou fazer algo rapidamente.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Acting with urgency or speed; moving or doing something quickly.
examples: She was always rushing in the mornings.
The team was rushing to meet the deadline.
He regretted rushing through his work.
Rushing water could be heard after the heavy rain.
They spent the day rushing from one meeting to another.

es.definition: Plural de apuro; múltiples situaciones de actuar con rapidez o urgencia.

pt.definition: Plural de apresso; múltiplas situações de agir com rapidez ou urgência.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Plural of rush; multiple situations of acting with speed or urgency.
examples: Morning rushes made the streets crowded.
The rushes in the newsroom were intense.
She experienced several rushes during her workday.
The rushes to complete tasks were overwhelming.
He recalled the rushes of his early career.

es.definition: Haber actuado con urgencia o rapidez; haberse movido o hecho algo rápidamente.

pt.definition: Ter agido com urgência ou rapidez; ter-se movido ou feito algo rapidamente.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: To have acted with urgency or speed; to have moved or done something quickly.
examples: He rushed through the assignment.
She felt rushed during the interview.
The project was rushed to completion.
They rushed to make the deadline.
The meal was rushed and unsatisfying.

es.definition: Seguir el ritmo; continuar o mantenerse al nivel de algo o alguien.

pt.definition: Acompanhar o ritmo; continuar ou manter-se ao nível de algo ou alguém.

type_word.name: Phrasal Verb
type_word.description: A verb combined with a preposition or an adverb (or both), where the combination creates a meaning different from the original verb, such as 'turn off' or 'run into'.

definition: To continue at the same rate or level; to keep pace with.
examples: She struggles to keep up with the class.
It's hard to keep up with the latest news.
He's been keeping up his exercise routine.
Keep up the good work!
They kept up with each other during the race.

es.definition: Continúa o se mantiene al nivel de algo o alguien.

pt.definition: Continua ou mantém-se ao nível de algo ou alguém.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: Continues or maintains the level with something or someone.
examples: He always keeps up with the latest trends.
She keeps up with her fitness routine.
The team keeps up with the competition.
The student keeps up with the coursework.
The garden keeps up with the changing seasons.

es.definition: Haber seguido el ritmo; haber continuado o mantenido el nivel con algo o alguien.

pt.definition: Ter acompanhado o ritmo; ter continuado ou mantido o nível com algo ou alguém.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: To have continued at the same rate or level; to have kept pace with.
examples: She kept up her studies despite the challenges.
They kept up the pace throughout the marathon.
He kept up with his colleagues professionally.
The business kept up with market changes.
She kept up with her correspondence regularly.

es.definition: Estar en el proceso de seguir el ritmo; continuar manteniéndose al nivel de algo o alguien.

pt.definition: Estar no processo de acompanhar o ritmo; continuar mantendo-se ao nível de algo ou alguém.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: Being in the process of continuing at the same rate or level; maintaining pace with something or someone.
examples: She's keeping up with her exercise regime.
They're keeping up with technological advances.
He's having trouble keeping up with the workload.
Keeping up with the Joneses can be exhausting.
She's been keeping up with her language studies.

es.definition: Una marca o herida superficial en una superficie, causada por algo afilado o áspero.

pt.definition: Uma marca ou ferida superficial em uma superfície, causada por algo afiado ou áspero.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: A mark or slight injury on a surface, caused by something sharp or rough.
examples: The cat left a scratch on the sofa.
He got a scratch on his arm while hiking.
She used a coin to scratch off the lottery ticket.
The table had a few scratches on its surface.
He felt an itch and started to scratch.

es.definition: Plural de rasguño; múltiples marcas o heridas superficiales en superficies.

pt.definition: Plural de arranhão; múltiplas marcas ou feridas superficiais em superfícies.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Plural of scratch; multiple marks or slight injuries on surfaces.
examples: The car had several scratches on the paintwork.
Her arms were covered in scratches from the brambles.
He inspected the disk for scratches.
The cat's scratches were visible on the wooden door.
She found scratches on the floor from moving furniture.

es.definition: Haber marcado o lesionado una superficie ligeramente con algo afilado o áspero.

pt.definition: Ter marcado ou lesionado uma superfície levemente com algo afiado ou áspero.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: To have marked or slightly injured a surface with something sharp or rough.
examples: The CD was scratched and wouldn't play properly.
She scratched her arm on the thorny bush.
He accidentally scratched the table while moving it.
The dog scratched at the door to be let out.
Her new glasses were already scratched.

es.definition: Estar en el proceso de marcar o lesionar ligeramente una superficie con algo afilado o áspero.

pt.definition: Estar no processo de marcar ou lesionar levemente uma superfície com algo afiado ou áspero.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: The act of marking or slightly injuring a surface with something sharp or rough.
examples: The cat was scratching the furniture again.
She kept scratching the mosquito bite.
He heard scratching sounds coming from the attic.
Scratching the itch only made it worse.
They found the dog scratching at the door.

es.definition: En una dirección hacia un punto más bajo o más lejos a lo largo de un camino o ruta.

pt.definition: Em uma direção para um ponto mais baixo ou mais distante ao longo de um caminho ou rota.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: In a direction toward a lower or farther point along a path or route.
examples: The village is a long way down the mountain road.
She looked way down the street and saw him.
They found the keys way down in the sofa cushions.
He pointed way down the trail where they came from.
The cat was way down at the bottom of the garden.

es.definition: Plural de camino abajo; en múltiples direcciones hacia puntos más bajos o más lejanos.

pt.definition: Plural de caminho abaixo; em múltiplas direções para pontos mais baixos ou mais distantes.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: Plural of way down; in multiple directions toward lower or farther points.
examples: They explored several ways down the mountain.
There are many ways down to the valley.
The children found different ways down the hill on their sleds.
They discussed the various ways down from the top of the building.
Explorers looked for ways down into the canyon.

es.definition: De tamaño, cantidad o grado menor o limitado; no grande.

pt.definition: De tamanho, quantidade ou grau menor ou limitado; não grande.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: Small in size, amount, or degree; not large.
examples: She gave him a little smile.
There's only a little milk left in the fridge.
He spoke very little about his past.
She felt a little better after resting.
The room was decorated with little flowers.

es.definition: Comparativo de pequeño; de tamaño, cantidad o grado aún menor.

pt.definition: Comparativo de pequeno; de tamanho, quantidade ou grau ainda menor.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Comparative of little; smaller in size, amount, or degree.
examples: He chose the littler of the two puppies.
She felt a littler bit relieved after the news.
The littler room was easier to clean.
He was the littler of the two brothers.
The littler details often make a big difference.

es.definition: Superlativo de pequeño; de tamaño, cantidad o grado más pequeño posible.

pt.definition: Superlativo de pequeno; de tamanho, quantidade ou grau mais pequeno possível.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Superlative of little; smallest in size, amount, or degree.
examples: She is the littlest member of the family.
He always pays attention to the littlest details.
The littlest puppy had the most energy.
They found joy in the littlest things.
The littlest room in the house was her favorite.

es.definition: La cualidad o condición de ser pequeño o de tamaño reducido.

pt.definition: A qualidade ou condição de ser pequeno ou de tamanho reduzido.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The quality or condition of being small in size or extent.
examples: The littleness of the room made it feel cozy.
She marveled at the littleness of the newborn's hands.
The littleness of the village was part of its charm.
He felt overwhelmed by the littleness of his achievements.
The littleness of the toy car made it perfect for the dollhouse.

es.definition: Haber arrojado o proyectado algo con fuerza; haber dejado caer algo bruscamente.

pt.definition: Ter atirado ou projetado algo com força; ter deixado cair algo bruscamente.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: To have propelled or cast something with force; to have dropped something abruptly.
examples: The ball was thrown with great precision.
She had thrown the letter in the trash.
He was thrown from the horse during the race.
The pot was thrown on a wheel by the artist.
The keys were thrown onto the table.

es.definition: Proyectar o arrojar algo con fuerza mediante un movimiento del brazo.

pt.definition: Projetar ou atirar algo com força através de um movimento do braço.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: To propel or cast something with force through an arm movement.
examples: He can throw a ball very far.
She learned how to throw a punch.
The player will throw the dice now.
They like to throw stones into the pond.
He accidentally threw his phone onto the bed.

es.definition: Proyectar o arrojar algo con fuerza; tercera persona del singular del presente de 'lanzar'.

pt.definition: Projetar ou atirar algo com força; terceira pessoa do singular do presente de 'lançar'.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: Propels or casts something with force; third person singular present of 'throw'.
examples: She throws the ball to her dog every morning.
He always throws his coat on the chair.
The quarterback throws the football accurately.
The machine throws sparks when it's operating.
The child throws his toys when he's upset.

es.definition: Estar en el proceso de proyectar o arrojar algo con fuerza.

pt.definition: Estar no processo de projetar ou atirar algo com força.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: In the process of propelling or casting something with force.
examples: They spent the afternoon throwing frisbees in the park.
The artist was throwing paint onto the canvas.
She's throwing a party next weekend.
He's been throwing hints about his birthday gift.
They were throwing snowballs during the winter storm.

es.definition: En o hacia todas las direcciones desde un punto central; cercanía o área circundante.

pt.definition: Em ou para todas as direções a partir de um ponto central; proximidade ou área circundante.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

type_word.name: Preposition
type_word.description: Words used before a noun or pronoun to form a phrase modifying another word in the sentence.

definition: In or to all directions from a central point; closeness or surrounding area.
examples: They walked around the park for hours.
Look around and you'll find it.
He spun around to face her.
There are many shops around here.
The rumors spread quickly around the town.

es.definition: Plural de alrededor; múltiples áreas o direcciones circundantes.

pt.definition: Plural de ao redor; múltiplas áreas ou direções circundantes.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Plural of around; multiple surrounding areas or directions.
examples: We explored the various arounds of the city.
The guide mentioned several interesting arounds to visit.
They discovered hidden gems in the arounds of the countryside.
Their journey took them to the different arounds of the region.
She has friends living in the arounds of the capital city.

es.definition: Adicional o diferente; uno más o un sustituto.

pt.definition: Adicional ou diferente; mais um ou um substituto.

type_word.name: Determiner
type_word.description: Words that introduce nouns and provide context.

type_word.name: Pronoun
type_word.description: Words used in place of a noun.

definition: Additional or different; one more or a substitute.
examples: Can I have another piece of cake?
She decided to read another book.
Let's try another approach to solve this.
He needs another hour to finish the work.
They're thinking of adopting another pet.

es.definition: Plural de otro; adicionales o diferentes; más de uno o sustitutos.

pt.definition: Plural de outro; adicionais ou diferentes; mais de um ou substitutos.

type_word.name: Determiner
type_word.description: Words that introduce nouns and provide context.

type_word.name: Pronoun
type_word.description: Words used in place of a noun.

definition: Plural of another; additional or different; more than one or substitutes.
examples: She bought anothers to replace the broken ones.
There are anothers ways to solve this problem.
They're considering anothers possibilities.
He had to meet with anothers clients during the day.
She enjoys reading books by anothers authors.

es.definition: Cerrar algo; tercera persona del singular del presente de 'cerrar'.

pt.definition: Fechar algo; terceira pessoa do singular do presente de 'fechar'.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: Shuts something; third person singular present of 'close'.
examples: The store closes at 8 PM.
She closes her eyes when she's thinking.
The theater closes after the last show.
He closes the deal with a handshake.
The flower closes its petals at night.

es.definition: Haber cerrado algo; pasado participio de 'cerrar'.

pt.definition: Ter fechado algo; particípio passado de 'fechar'.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: To have shut something; past participle of 'close'.
examples: The door was closed quietly.
The shop is closed on Sundays.
All windows must be closed during the storm.
The case has been officially closed.
He closed his eyes and fell asleep.

es.definition: Estar en el proceso de cerrar algo.

pt.definition: Estar no processo de fechar algo.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: In the process of shutting something.
examples: They're closing the store for renovations.
He's closing his laptop for the day.
The curtains were closing on the stage.
She's closing the deal with the clients.
The festival is closing with a fireworks display.

es.definition: De manera atenta o con gran atención al detalle.

pt.definition: De maneira atenta ou com grande atenção ao detalhe.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: In a manner that is close in proximity or scrutiny; attentively.
examples: The detective examined the scene closely.
Their opinions are closely aligned.
She followed the instructions closely.
The siblings resemble each other very closely.
Closely monitor the patient's condition.

es.definition: Que se adhiere a otras superficies; viscoso o adherente.

pt.definition: Que adere a outras superfícies; viscoso ou aderente.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Tending to adhere to objects upon contact; adhesive or tacky.
examples: The floor was sticky from spilled juice.
She had sticky fingers after eating candy.
Sticky notes are useful for reminders.
The humid weather made everything feel sticky.
He avoided the sticky sap on the tree.

es.definition: Comparativo de pegajoso; más propenso a adherirse o ser viscoso.

pt.definition: Comparativo de pegajoso; mais propenso a aderir ou ser viscoso.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Comparative of sticky; more prone to adhering or being viscous.
examples: The weather gets stickier in the summer.
This syrup is stickier than honey.
The situation became stickier than expected.
Her hands were stickier after playing with the glue.
The stickier dough is harder to knead.

es.definition: Superlativo de pegajoso; extremadamente propenso a adherirse o ser muy viscoso.

pt.definition: Superlativo de pegajoso; extremamente propenso a aderir ou ser muito viscoso.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Superlative of sticky; extremely prone to adhering or being very viscous.
examples: This is the stickiest gum I've ever chewed.
The stickiest part of the project was the budget.
They found themselves in the stickiest situation.
The stickiest tape was used for the repairs.
It was the stickiest day of the year.

es.definition: De manera pegajosa; con una cualidad de adherencia o viscosidad.

pt.definition: De maneira pegajosa; com uma qualidade de aderência ou viscosidade.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: In a sticky manner; with a quality of adhesiveness or viscosity.
examples: The label stickily adhered to the jar.
He walked stickily over the spilled syrup.
The pages of the book were stickily clinging together.
She spoke stickily, her mouth full of peanut butter.
The heat made their skin feel stickily uncomfortable.

es.definition: De manera justa o correcta; con justicia o equidad.

pt.definition: De maneira justa ou correta; com justiça ou equidade.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: In a fair or right manner; with justice or fairness.
examples: He was justly rewarded for his hard work.
The judge is known to rule justly.
She spoke justly of the need for change.
The award was justly deserved.
He justly criticized the unfair policy.

es.definition: Llegar a un lugar; tercera persona del singular del presente de 'venir'.

pt.definition: Chegar a um lugar; terceira pessoa do singular do presente de 'vir'.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: Arrives at a place; third person singular present of 'come'.
examples: Winter comes after autumn.
Success comes with hard work.
The train comes at 5 o'clock.
Peace comes from understanding.
Good news comes to those who wait.

es.definition: Estar en el proceso de llegar a un lugar.

pt.definition: Estar no processo de chegar a um lugar.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: In the process of arriving at a place.
examples: He is coming to the party tonight.
The storm is coming soon.
She is coming to terms with the situation.
The holidays are coming up quickly.
A new era is coming.

es.definition: Haber llegado a un lugar; pasado de 'venir'.

pt.definition: Ter chegado a um lugar; passado de 'vir'.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: To have arrived at a place; past tense of 'come'.
examples: She came to the meeting prepared.
He came home late last night.
They came from different backgrounds.
The answer came to him suddenly.
Summer came and went quickly.

es.definition: En un modo que puede ser discutido, debatido o cuestionado; posiblemente.

pt.definition: De um modo que pode ser discutido, debatido ou questionado; possivelmente.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: In a way that is open to argument or debate; possibly.
examples: He is arguably the best player on the team.
This is arguably her finest performance.
Arguably, the law needs to be revised.
It was arguably the most important decision of his life.
The city is arguably the cultural capital of the world.
